title: Drawing, "Designs for Colored Glass Vases", ca. 1850
medium: Brush and rose and green wash, gold gouache, graphite on white wove paper
inscribed: inscribed in pen and brown ink, bottom margin: N 3833 N 3832 N 3832; on verso, bottom margin: N3829 N 3830
description: Designs for three glasswares. In the center is a green vase with vegetal patterns on it. On either side of it are red vases with ovals cut out of their centers.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Designs for Colored Glass Vases", ca. 1850.
ca. 1850. Brush and rose and green wash, gold gouache, graphite on white wove paper. Gift of Virginia Hamill. 1953-82-2.
